blocks.text: The ICOM IC-7300 is an HF/50 MHz transceiver featuring RF direct sampling technology where RF signals are directly converted to digital data and processed in an FPGA. Key features include a real-time spectrum scope, 4.3 inch color touch screen, and built-in automatic antenna tuner.
To turn the transceiver ON, push [POWER]. To turn OFF, push and hold [POWER] for 1 second. The AF control adjusts audio output level. The RF/SQL control adjusts RF gain and squelch threshold.
To change the operating frequency, rotate MAIN DIAL. The friction adjuster allows you to customize the dial feel. Touch the MHz digits on the display to access the band selection screen.
To change modes, touch the mode indicator (SSB, CW, RTTY, AM, FM) on the display. Available modes are USB, LSB, CW, RTTY, AM, and FM.
The spectrum scope provides real-time visualization of signals. Push [M.SCOPE] to toggle between Mini Scope and full Spectrum Scope views. Touch the scope screen to tune directly to a signal.
The IP+ function improves 3rd order intercept point (IP3) performance when receiving weak signals adjacent to strong interference. Enable it via MENU > SET > Function > IP Plus.

Access the SET menu by pushing [MENU] and touching SET. Use the MULTI control to scroll and select items. The menu is organized into categories including Function, Connectors, Display, Time Set, SD Card, and Others.

blocks.name: IP Plus
blocks.description: Improves IP3 performance for better weak signal reception near strong signals. Options: ON or OFF. Found in SET > Function.

blocks.name: Quick Tuning Step
blocks.description: Sets the tuning step for quick frequency changes. Touch kHz digits for 1 second to select step: 0.1, 1, 5, 6.25, 9, 10, 12.5, 20, 25, 50, or 100 kHz.

blocks.name: Display Type
blocks.description: Selects the main display style: A (Scope + Meters), B (Meters + Memory), or C (Large Scope). Found in SET > Display.

blocks.name: Screen Saver
blocks.description: Sets the time until the screen saver activates: OFF, 15, 30, or 60 minutes. Found in SET > Display.

blocks.name: CI-V Baud Rate
blocks.description: Sets the CI-V transfer speed: 4800, 9600, 19200, or Auto. Found in SET > Connectors.

blocks.name: DATA MOD
blocks.description: Selects modulation input when DATA mode is active: MIC, ACC, USB, or MIC+ACC. Found in SET > Connectors.

blocks.text: Touch any item or option for 1 second to open the Quick menu, then touch 'Default' to reset that setting to factory default.
Connect a paddle or straight key to the [KEY] jack on the rear panel using the supplied 6.35mm (1/4") stereo plug. The internal electronic keyer supports both paddle and straight key operation.

blocks.name: Key Type
blocks.description: Selects key input type: Paddle (internal keyer), Straight key, or Bug key mode. Found in MENU > KEYER > EDIT/SET > CW-KEY SET.

blocks.name: CW Key Speed
blocks.description: Sets internal keyer speed from 6 to 48 WPM. Access via Multi-function menu in CW mode by touching SPEED, then rotate MULTI to adjust.

blocks.name: CW Pitch
blocks.description: Sets CW sidetone and receive audio pitch from 300 to 900 Hz. Access via Multi-function menu in CW mode by touching PITCH.

blocks.name: Side Tone Level
blocks.description: Adjusts CW sidetone volume. Found in MENU > KEYER > EDIT/SET > CW-KEY SET.

blocks.name: Paddle Polarity
blocks.description: Reverses dot and dash paddles: Normal or Reverse. Found in MENU > KEYER > EDIT/SET > CW-KEY SET.

blocks.text: For Break-in operation, push [VOX/BK-IN] to cycle through OFF, Semi break-in, and Full break-in (QSK). Full break-in allows hearing between transmitted elements.
The [AUTO TUNE] button automatically zeros in on a received CW signal. In CW mode, push [AUTO TUNE] when a signal is present. The frequency adjusts to center the signal on your CW pitch.
The IC-7300 uses digital IF filtering processed in the FPGA with a 36 kHz IF frequency. Three filter widths (FIL1, FIL2, FIL3) are available per mode. Filter shape can be set to SHARP or SOFT.

Twin PBT (Passband Tuning) shifts the IF passband to reject interference. Access via the Multi-function menu and adjust using the MULTI control. The spectrum scope shows the filter passband in real-time.

blocks.name: Noise Blanker (NB)
blocks.description: Eliminates pulse-type noise from ignition systems. Touch NB on the Multi-function menu to toggle. Touch for 1 second to adjust Level, Depth, and Width parameters.

blocks.name: Noise Reduction (NR)
blocks.description: DSP noise reduction for random noise. Touch NR on Multi-function menu to toggle. Touch for 1 second to adjust level (0-15).

blocks.name: Auto Notch (AN)
blocks.description: Automatically attenuates beat tones and interfering carriers. Touch NOTCH on Multi-function menu to cycle through Auto (AN), Manual (MN), and OFF.

blocks.name: Preamplifier
blocks.description: P.AMP1 is optimized for HF (1.8-29.999 MHz). P.AMP2 is optimized for 50/70 MHz. Touch P.AMP on Multi-function menu to select.

blocks.name: Attenuator
blocks.description: Provides attenuation to prevent overload from strong signals. Touch ATT on Multi-function menu to select level.

blocks.name: Twin Peak Filter (TPF)
blocks.description: RTTY-specific filter that boosts mark and space frequencies for better RTTY reception. Available only in RTTY mode.

blocks.text: The IC-7300 requires 13.8V DC power. Connect using the supplied DC power cable with fuse holder. The transceiver is designed for base station use and does not have internal battery capability.
NEVER apply more than 16V DC or reverse polarity. NEVER apply AC power to the DC socket. NEVER remove the fuse holder from the DC power cable.
The rear panel will become hot during extended high-power operation. Ensure adequate ventilation and do not block cooling vents.
The IC-7300 has a built-in automatic antenna tuner that covers HF through 50 MHz (and 70 MHz on applicable versions). The tuner can match impedances resulting in up to 3:1 VSWR.
To enable the tuner, push [TUNER]. The TUNER indicator lights when active. The tuner settings are automatically recalled when you change bands.
To manually tune, hold [TUNER] for 1 second while the tuner is ON. The transceiver transmits a tuning signal while the tuner adjusts. Typical tuning time is 2-3 seconds, maximum 15 seconds.
The tuner cannot match all antenna systems. If the tuner cannot achieve a match, it will time out and bypass. Check your antenna system if tuning consistently fails.
Do not transmit at full power with high SWR. High SWR can damage the transceiver. Always ensure the antenna system is properly matched before operating at high power.

rows.name: Operating Modes
rows.value: USB, LSB, CW, RTTY, AM, FM

rows.name: Dimensions
rows.value: 240 x 94 x 238 mm (W x H x D)

blocks.name: No power
blocks.description: Check DC power connection and fuses. Verify supply voltage is 13.8V +/-15%. Check that the power switch is pushed (not just touched).

blocks.name: No audio
blocks.description: Check AF volume control. Verify squelch is not set too tight. Check if headphones are plugged in (mutes internal speaker).

blocks.name: Cannot transmit
blocks.description: Verify frequency is within amateur band limits. Check antenna connection. Verify [TRANSMIT] button toggles to TX. Check if PTT Lock is enabled.

blocks.name: Dial doesn't change frequency
blocks.description: Check if Lock function is enabled (lock icon displayed). Push [SPEECH/LOCK] for 1 second to toggle lock.

blocks.name: Tuner won't tune
blocks.description: Verify antenna SWR is less than 3:1 before engaging tuner. Check that tuner is enabled (TUNER indicator lit). Allow tuner to complete its cycle.

blocks.name: Touch screen unresponsive
blocks.description: Try the touch screen calibration: MENU > SET > Others > Touch Screen Calibration. Do not use screen protectors that interfere with touch sensitivity.

blocks.name: SD card not recognized
blocks.description: Use SDHC cards up to 32GB. Format in FAT32. Ensure card is fully inserted into the slot on the front panel.

blocks.name: Spectrum scope shows no signals
blocks.description: Check that the scope is enabled (M.SCOPE). Verify the scope reference level and span settings. Ensure antenna is connected.
